node.title: Latest on COVID from around the world: Virus surges in Japan, Swedish Princess tests positive
node.content: ["More than 303.95 million people have been reported to be infected by the novel coronavirus globally and 5,482,864 have died, according to Johns Hopkins University data.\n", "Here's the latest on the COVID-19 pandemic from around the world.", "The country reported 197,552 COVID-19 cases on Saturday, up from 108,304 the day before, the health ministry said, while the number of deaths fell to 184 from 223.", "The United Kingdom reported 146,390 new cases of COVID-19 on Saturday, down from 178,250 cases on Friday, while the number of new deaths reported increased to 313 from 229, official figures showed.", "Anti-vaccine protesters rallied in cities across France on Saturday, denouncing President Emmanuel Macron's intent to \"piss off\" people refusing COVID-19 shots by tightening curbs on their civil liberties.", "Crown Princess Victoria has tested positive for COVID-19 and is experiencing mild symptoms, the Royal Court said on Saturday, adding the heir to the throne was fully vaccinated.", "Earlier this week her parents, the King and Queen of Sweden, both also tested positive amid a mounting fourth wave of the virus, driven by the highly contagious Omicron variant that has seen the country repeatedly report record daily case numbers.", "The Omicron variant now accounts for 44 percent of coronavirus infections in Germany, the Robert Koch Institute (RKI) for infectious disease said.", "Superman, Cinderella and Minions were among characters from films, comics and fairy tales who greeted children at a COVID-19 vaccination centre in Prague on Saturday to ease their nerves as they came to be inoculated.", "Despite a lull in coronavirus infections in the past month, the Czech Republic is trying to boost vaccination rates because it is bracing for the Omicron coronavirus variant. Vaccinations lag other EU countries.", "Chancellor Karl Nehammer said on Saturday he was well and had no COVID-19 symptoms after testing positive for the coronavirus this week, vowing to do everything possible to prevent another nationwide lockdown.", "US Forces Korea (USFK) raised its health protection alert on Saturday after posting its highest weekly tally of new coronavirus infections, at 682.", "The new cases bring the total infections to 3027. US forces have said nearly 90 percent of its soldiers, families and other affiliated people were vaccinated.", "New daily coronavirus cases in the Japanese capital of Tokyo are likely to rise above 1200 on Saturday, the highest since September 11, TBS television said, citing unidentified officials.", "COVID-19 is surging in Japan, and the country is stepping up restrictions in three regions that host US military bases, which some officials say have helped fuel the spike.", "Treasurer Josh Frydenberg said he tested positive to COVID-19, joining other top government officials in contracting the disease as the daily infection rate surpassed 100,000 for the first time amid an outbreak of the Omicron variant.", "Omicron is taking over Delta in Indian cities, as the country reported 141,986 new COVID-19 cases on Saturday, the most since the end of May.", "The health ministry also reported 285 new deaths, taking the total to 483,463. Total infections stand at 35.37 million.\u00a0", "The country reported 159 confirmed coronavirus cases for Janurary 7, down from 174 a day earlier, its health authority said on Saturday.", "Leader Carrie Lam has ordered an investigation into the behaviour of 13 senior government officials who attended the birthday bash of a delegate to China's legislature, where two of the 170 guests tested positive for the coronavirus.", "Mexico's official COVID-19 death toll breached the 300,000 mark on Friday (local time), as the number of new cases jumped, figures published by the health ministry showed.", "It registered 28,023 new COVID-19 cases and 168 additional deaths, bringing the total number of confirmed cases to 4,083,118 and the death toll to 300,101, the data showed.\u00a0", "The health ministry says Brazil has had 63,292 new cases of the coronavirus reported in the previous 24 hours and 181 deaths from COVID-19.", "That is the highest number of daily infections since July last year. Health experts say the Omicron variant is spreading in the South American country.", "Brazil has now registered 22,450,222 cases since the pandemic began, while the official death toll has risen to 619,822, according to ministry data. Brazil's COVID-19 death toll trails only the US and Russia, according to Reuters calculations.", "Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd has paused some of its cruise operations amid rising numbers of COVID-19 infections due to the Omicron variant."]
